alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 10:30PM AKST until February 01 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Areas Around The Salmon River Near The Gravel Pits, Rink Creek And Wilson Road. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around the Salmon River near the gravel pits, Rink Creek and Wilson Road. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Salmon River. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible. - For Salmon River at Gustavus : At 9:15pm the stage was 15.59 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Impacts: At 15.5 feet: Water will begin to flow over Wilson and Rink Creek roads and ditches will be full. Roads will be soft in places and travel across these areas will be difficult. At 16.5 feet: The Wilson and Rink Creek corridor will have 1-3 feet of water over the road to become impassable in places and structures will begin to flood. Power may be cut off from Chase Drive out to Rink Creek.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
